sub_title: Business Process Specialist (Expert) in Supply Chain Planning
summary:
Motivated self-starter with the written-communication skills, problem-solving abilities, multi-tasking talents, and strong work ethic to make a significant contribution to any organization. Dynamic project-management professional with more than five years of significant and progressive experience and proven leadership skills through interacting with multiple business units involving cross-functional implementation activities. Goal-driven achiever with strong organizational and analytical skills, demonstrated expertise in management, and the proven ability to assume primary role in delivering components of major projects.

Final Project: The first design of “Powdered Sugar Sifter” specifically for “Merritt” Bakery in Tulsa, Oklahoma, under $1,000 budget from Merritt’s Bakery owners and the Department of Mechanical Engineering of the University of Tulsa. 
U.S. Patent Pending 1998.

Specialties: Mechanical Design Engineer, Purchaser, Logistics Controller, Planner, Programmer, Administrator.

education.field_of_study: Mechanical Engineering with a minor in Computer Science

profile_positions.title: Senior Project Leader - Supply Chain Planning Process Controller

profile_positions.description: A 2-year assignment in ASML Wilton Office having a role using LSM expertise and strategical tools within New Product Logistics team, responsible for supplier's preparedness of new product introduction and interface with various sectors to create supply chain visibility and to secure supply chain management, in respect to complex or critical parts, including a continuous supply chain risk analysis and action plans to improve, prior to the release for volume.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Leader - New Product Logistics

profile_positions.description:
Sr. Project Leader of Logistics Supplier Management is responsible for the supply chain management dedicated for strategic suppliers.
Key areas of responsibilities are as follows within volume and new products:
• Managing strategic suppliers towards competitive logistic performance
• Cycle time / order lead time reduction programs at suppliers
• Implementation of buffer stocks to safeguard ASML ramping capabilities
• Optimize output of the supplier supply chain to meet ASML demand and demand changes
• Continuous supply chain risk analysis & action plans to improve
• Implementation of the supply chain planning roadmap in ASML and ASML supplier network
• Escalation management to solve structural bottlenecks in supply chain for selected supplier network
Also responsible for implementation of state of air IT solutions (SQL & Excel Data Analysis) for cycle time reduction, supply chain transparency tool, move-rate, and logistics dashboard database.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Leader - Logistics Supplier Management

profile_positions.description:
• Managing a small team of four people to support sales team and other departments.
• Achieving for road and air transport cost reduction by having 3PL while improving leadtimes.
• Setting up measurement of quality control parameters for 3rd party warehouse – logistics. 
• Implementing quality control of general administration process management with PDCA method.
• Generating and maintaining excel based database for Optical Drive Division and Consumer Electronics Division to enable to monitor Sales P&L, forecasting, inventory control, as well as capacity and buffers including deep analysis of financial reports.
• Coordinating, maintaining, and controlling GFR for PLDS & Lite-On IT Corporation in EU.
• Providing Root Cause Analysis for daily operational matters, including assisting to (acting) Managing Director.
• Implemented state of the art IT solutions (SQL & Excel Data Analysis) for all F&A, Sales, and Logistics administrative for a far better accuracy, efficiency, easily to be monitored and to be controlled.
• Providing financial analysis for top management decision making of Annual Plan & Budget for EU CHANNEL business, including sales forecast against cost price simulation to bring a balancing P&L.
• Providing strategic plans toward dynamic supply chain performance, and actively managing cycle time and supply lead time reduction in coordination with HQ’s supply chain policy.
• Providing insight in and maintaining overview of the supply chain planning in regard to production, buffers, and lead-time for next three months to monitor and to help in the realization of the roadmap & demands/targets.
• Acting as a procurement process for Lite-On IT Corporation for European vendors.
• Maintaining, controlling, providing continuous improvement overall office procedures and daily operation processes for each department within the company.
• Gaining overall knowledge in general VAT & customs regulations, Inco terms 2010 including customs clearance.
profile_positions.title: Office Administration/HR & European Logistics Manager

profile_positions.description:
Managing a small team of four people to support sales team and other departments.
• Achieving for road, air transport cost reduction by having 3PL forwarding partners as well as to improve leadtime
service to clients.
• Setting up measurement of quality control parameters for 3rd party warehouse – logistics partner in NL.
• Implementing and maintaining business quality control of office administration and logistics daily process
management with PDCA (Plan Do Check Act) method.
• Generating and maintaining excel based database for Optical Drive Division and Consumer Electronics Division to
enable to monitor Sales P&L, forecasting, inventory control, as well as capacity and buffers.
• Generating, maintaining, and deep analyzing weekly & monthly end financial analysis reports to top
management.
• Acting as a middle logistics to communicate between, clients, sales persons, and public warehouse to ensure
that delivery schedules are always achieved without delays.
• Coordinating, maintaining, and controlling GFR for PLDS & Lite-On IT Corporation in European distribution.
• Providing any possible cost reduction within logistics area for PLDS & Lite-On IT Corporation.
• Providing Root Cause Analysis for daily operational matters, including assisting to (acting) Managing Director.
profile_positions.title: Logistics Supervisor (Digital & Optical)

profile_positions.description:
Supporting and assisting the sales persons within department to make proforma invoices, shipping documents, and credit notes. Generated and maintained a few documents and weekly as well as monthly reports to the local managing director and head-quarter in Taiwan. 
Sending samples to and supporting customers and maintaining customers’ relationships.
Maintaining the warehouse transactions and product inventory as well as monthly production and sales target. 
Acting as an internal logistics person to communicate between sales persons and warehouse to ensure that delivery schedules are always achieved without delays.
profile_positions.title: Sales Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Developed and managed a project so-called “Leica Stage (XY Table) Mechanical and Controller Board” as a part of the latest Leica EBPG5000 Plus tool maker to fine tune to maximum performance to achieve the high demands’ customer specifications.
Generated and managed a modeling analysis program using MatLab for troubleshooting writing errors. 
Provided Root Cause Analysis and technical support for the after-market products to customers and technicians.  
Responsible for new engineering design and actively involved in engineering research and development with external suppliers.
Created, developed, managed and responsible for design changes through Engineering Change Requests and standardized available in-house bill of materials, as well as engineering procedures for Leica and external suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for customer’s inquires and demands in which require design-engineering skills.
Performed Root Cause Analysis, troubleshot, and resolved difficult process engineering issues and warranty related orders. Interacted actively with worldwide sales, dealers, and/or customers to resolve field problems. 
Responsible for translating and reporting Root Cause Analysis to internal Quality Engineer to take a part in improving in-house reliability and to assure customer’s satisfactory.
Planned, processed, and managed Engineering Change Requests and standardized available in-house bill of materials. 
Generated internal and external product documentation, presentations and/or technical reports.
Developed and managed a standardized program for Submersible Motor Data and Modeling Analysis (has more than 500 records) resulting 30% response time improvement in internal as well as external sales in the United States and overseas.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer
